### 2 Share of en route and terminal in gate-to-gate actual costs (2022)

:::: {.columns}
  
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/2022/Latvia/9_G2G_1.png)
:::

::: {.column width="2%"}
:::

::: {.column width="48%"}
In the year 2022, actual gate-to-gate ANS costs are -4.0% (-0.9 M€2017) lower than planned, as en route costs are lower than planned by -1.1 M€2017 and terminal costs are higher than planned by +0.1 M€2017.<br/><br/>The actual share of en route in gate-to-gate ANS costs (75%) is lower than planned in the PP for 2022 (76.7%).
:::

::::

### 3 Gate-to-gate regulatory result (RR) 

```{r}
#| file: R/table_ceff_g2g_4.R
#| out.width: "100%"
```  
<br>

:::: {.columns}
  
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/2022/Latvia/9_G2G_2.png)
:::

::: {.column width="2%"}
:::

::: {.column width="48%"}
For the ANSPs providing services in the en route and terminal charging zones of Latvia covered by the SES performance scheme, the ex-post gate-to-gate regulatory result in 2022 amounts to +2.6 M€ (+2.3 M€  for en route and +0.2 M€ for terminal - see boxes 10 to 14 for the detailed analysis at charging zones level), corresponding to 10.5% of gate-to-gate ANS revenues.<br/><br/>This is higher than the return planned for the year (6.2% of gate-to-gate revenues).
:::

::::
